headline: General Mills Outlines Progress on Accelerate Strategy at CAGNY Conference
summary: MINNEAPOLIS, February 17, 2026--General Mills, Inc. (NYSE: GIS) will share an update on the company’s Accelerate strategy and key initiatives at today’s Consumer Analyst Group of New York (CAGNY) Conference. Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Jeff Harmening, Chief Financial Officer Kofi Bruce, and Group President of North America Retail and North America Pet Dana McNabb will outline plans to drive sustainable growth by delivering greater remarkability through the company’s global brands.

content.title: General Mills Outlines Progress on Accelerate Strategy at CAGNY Conference
content.summary: MINNEAPOLIS, February 17, 2026--General Mills, Inc. (NYSE: GIS) will share an update on the company’s Accelerate strategy and key initiatives at today’s Consumer Analyst Group of New York (CAGNY) Conference. Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Jeff Harmening, Chief Financial Officer Kofi Bruce, and Group President of North America Retail and North America Pet Dana McNabb will outline plans to drive sustainable growth by delivering greater remarkability through the company’s global brands.

headline: General Mills shares fall as weak consumer demand triggers outlook cut
summary: Investing.com -- Shares of General Mills are down around 3.6% in premarket trading on Tuesday after the company cut its full-year fiscal 2026 outlook, citing weak consumer sentiment and a slower-than-expected volume recovery.

content.title: General Mills shares fall as weak consumer demand triggers outlook cut
content.summary: Investing.com -- Shares of General Mills are down around 3.6% in premarket trading on Tuesday after the company cut its full-year fiscal 2026 outlook, citing weak consumer sentiment and a slower-than-expected volume recovery.

headline: General Mills Sees Lower Sales on Weak Consumer Sentiment
summary: The maker of Cheerios and other food products said it now expects organic net sales to be down 1.5% to 2%, compared with its previous outlook of down 1% to up 1%.  “Weak consumer sentiment, heightened uncertainty, and significant volatility have weighed on category growth and impacted consumer purchase patterns,” the company said in a statement Tuesday ahead of a conference presentation.  Chief Executive Officer Jeff Harmening said cereal, snacks and dog food were seeing the biggest hits from the shakier consumer environment, fueled by higher inflation, reductions in food aid benefits and geopolitical uncertainty.

content.title: General Mills Sees Lower Sales on Weak Consumer Sentiment
content.summary: The maker of Cheerios and other food products said it now expects organic net sales to be down 1.5% to 2%, compared with its previous outlook of down 1% to up 1%.  “Weak consumer sentiment, heightened uncertainty, and significant volatility have weighed on category growth and impacted consumer purchase patterns,” the company said in a statement Tuesday ahead of a conference presentation.  Chief Executive Officer Jeff Harmening said cereal, snacks and dog food were seeing the biggest hits from the shakier consumer environment, fueled by higher inflation, reductions in food aid benefits and geopolitical uncertainty.

headline: Stocks Move Lower as Nasdaq Leads Losses
summary: STOCKS  The pressure on tech stocks continues. All three major indexes traded lower Tuesday morning, with the Nasdaq composite falling the furthest. Major decliners coming out of the long weekend included CrowdStrike AMD, AppLovin and Strategy, the bitcoin-buying company.

headline: General Mills Wants to Win Health-Conscious Shoppers; Outlook Cut Slams Stock
summary: General Mills is getting aboard the GLP-1 train as it navigates shaky consumer sentiment. Chief Executive Jeff Harmening told investors Tuesday that the weight-loss drugs will have a lasting influence on the business of food, nudging some consumers toward smaller portions, and more nutrient-dense products.

headline: General Mills Cuts Outlook Due to Weak Consumer Sentiment
summary: General Mills lowered its sales and profit outlook for the fiscal year, as stressed consumers are buying fewer snacks and looking for more promotions.

content.title: General Mills Cuts Outlook Due to Weak Consumer Sentiment

headline: US stock indexes slip in their return from a 3-day weekend
summary: U.S. stock indexes are drifting lower on Tuesday in their return to trading from a three-day holiday weekend.  General Mills sank 6.8% after the company behind the Cheerios, Nature Valley and Pillsbury brands said customers are feeling less confident.  Several surveys have recently shown weak confidence among U.S. households, which are struggling with inflation that remains high, a job market coming off a weak year of growth and worries about tariffs.

content.title: US stock indexes slip in their return from a 3-day weekend

General Mills sank 6.8% after the company behind the Cheerios, Nature Valley and Pillsbury brands said customers are feeling less confident.  Several surveys have recently shown weak confidence among U.S. households, which are struggling with inflation that remains high, a job market coming off a weak year of growth and worries about tariffs.

headline: Medtronic stock falls despite Q3 beat, Gemini's C-Suite shakeup

headline: Wall Street swings with worries about tech stocks and discouraged US shoppers
summary: The U.S. stock market is swinging in uneasy trading on Tuesday as companies talk about how discouraged their customers are feeling and some tech stocks continue to feel the downside of the artificial-intelligence boom.  Several surveys have recently shown weak confidence among U.S. households, which are struggling with inflation that remains higher than anyone would like, a job market coming off a weak year of growth and worries about tariffs.  Genuine Parts, which sells auto and industrial replacement parts, said it’s also “navigating a dynamic environment” while reporting weaker results for the latest quarter than analysts expected.

content.title: Wall Street swings with worries about tech stocks and discouraged US shoppers
content.summary: The U.S. stock market is swinging in uneasy trading on Tuesday as companies talk about how discouraged their customers are feeling and some tech stocks continue to feel the downside of the artificial-intelligence boom.  Several surveys have recently shown weak confidence among U.S. households, which are struggling with inflation that remains higher than anyone would like, a job market coming off a weak year of growth and worries about tariffs.  Genuine Parts, which sells auto and industrial replacement parts, said it’s also “navigating a dynamic environment” while reporting weaker results for the latest quarter than analysts expected.

headline: General Mills cuts annual outlook as shoppers seek cheaper options
summary:
STORY: General Mills shares fell more than eight percent Tuesday morning after the cereal maker cut its annual core sales and profit forecasts.

The producer of Cheerios and other brands is contending with a volatile economic backdrop and evolving consumer tastes.

Shares have fallen nearly 19% in the last 12 months.

General Mills and other packaged food companies are under pressure as lower-income shoppers, hit hardest by persistent inflation, trade down to value brands and private-label goods. 

At the same time, the industry is contending with evolving dietary preferences and a growing push toward healthier foods, accelerated by the broader adoption of GLP-1 weight‑loss drugs.

CEO Jeffrey Harmening said at a conference on Tuesday that, quote, "Cost of living and housing pressures are reshaping spending patterns, and value is a core expectation that is here to stay.”

Earlier this month, PepsiCo cut some prices following a consumer backlash against earlier price hikes, while Kraft Heinz last week paused plans to split the company and forecast weak annual earnings after missing quarterly results estimates on tepid demand.

General Mills now expects annual sales to be down 1.5% to 2%, compared with its previous range of down 1% to an increase of 1%.

One analyst tells Reuters the forecast now seems more realistic.

content.title: General Mills cuts annual outlook as shoppers seek cheaper options
content.summary:
